info.description: Backend server for the wacraft project. Handles WhatsApp Cloud API operations, including message sending, receiving, and webhook handling.
info.title: wacraft Server API

post.description: Accepts a workspace invitation. Creates user if doesn't exist.
Sends a password reset email to the user if the email exists.
Creates a new user account and sends verification email if required.
Resends the email verification link to the user's email.
Resets the user's password using the token from the reset email.

get.description: Verifies a user's email address using the token from the verification email.
Retrieves a paginated list of campaigns based on query parameters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

post.description: Creates a new campaign using the provided data and returns the created object.

delete.description: Deletes a campaign using the provided ID in the request body.

patch.description: Updates an existing campaign using the provided ID and data.

get.description: Applies a ILIKE filter on the specified key field and returns paginated results.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., decoding or query error)

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of send errors associated with campaign messages.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

200.description: List of campaign message send errors

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of messages associated with campaigns.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

post.description: Creates a new campaign message using the provided data and returns the created object.

delete.description: Deletes a campaign message using the provided ID in the request body.

get.description: Returns the total number of campaign messages that match the given filters.
Returns the number of campaign messages where the message ID is not null (sent messages).
Returns the number of campaign messages where the message ID is null (unsent messages).
Retrieves a paginated list of campaign messages that have been sent.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of campaign messages that were not sent.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns a paginated list of contacts using optional query parameters for filtering and sorting.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

put.description: Updates an existing contact using the provided ID and data.

post.description: Creates a new contact using the provided data and returns the created object.

delete.description: Deletes a contact based on the ID sent in the request body.

get.description: Downloads media using a temporary URL retrieved via the WhatsApp API.

post.description: Receives MediaInfo JSON, validates it, downloads the media from the provided URL, and streams it.

parameters.description: Media Info with URL and metadata
parameters.name: mediaInfo

post.description: Uploads a media file to WhatsApp. Files remain available for up to 30 days unless deleted earlier.

parameters.description: MIME type of the media file
parameters.name: type

get.description: Uses the WhatsApp API to retrieve a temporary media download URL. This URL expires in 5 minutes.
Fetches a paginated list of messages filtered by sender, receiver, messaging product, etc.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Matches the given text using ILIKE against `sender_data`, `receiver_data`, and `product_data` fields.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Uses ILIKE to match the given text in the specified key field. The fields `from` and `to` are populated in the result.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of the latest messages per conversation, enriched with contact information.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Counts distinct conversations based on the provided filters.
Counts messages exchanged with the specified messaging product contact based on filters.
Counts messages from a messaging product contact matching a "like" pattern on sender, receiver, or product data.

parameters.description: Substring to match against sender, receiver, or product data
parameters.name: likeText

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of messages sent or received by the specified messaging product contact.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns messages filtered by a "like" match on sender, receiver, or product data.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Substring to match against sender, receiver, or product data
parameters.name: likeText

get.description: Returns the total number of messages matching the specified filters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns the number of messages where the provided text matches content fields like sender_data, receiver_data, or product_data.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Substring to search in content fields
parameters.name: likeText

post.description: Sends a WhatsApp message and stores it in the database if the operation is successful.

500.description: Failed to send or save the message

post.description: Marks the latest WhatsApp message in the conversation as read so the user sees the double blue check.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

500.description: Failed to mark conversation as read

post.description: Queries for messages and uses the message.id value to mark the message as read and display a typing indicator so the WhatsApp user knows you are preparing a response. This is good practice if it will take you a few seconds to respond. The typing indicator will be dismissed once you respond, or after 25 seconds, whichever comes first. To prevent a poor user experience, only display a typing indicator if you are going to respond.
post.summary: Mark last message as read and starts typing

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of messages where the wamID matches and filters are applied.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of messaging products using optional filters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of messaging product contacts, joining with the contact entity.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

post.description: Creates and stores a new contact associated with a messaging product.

delete.description: Deletes a messaging product contact using the provided ID.

parameters.description: Messaging product contact ID to delete
parameters.name: body

delete.description: Unblocks a messaging product contact by ID so it can send messages again.

patch.description: Blocks a messaging product contact by ID. Messages from this contact will be ignored.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of messaging product contacts where the provided text matches contact name, email, or product_details fields using ILIKE.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns the number of messaging product contacts that match the provided text (with ILIKE operator) in fields like name, email, and product_details.

put.description: Sets the `last_read_at` field of the specified messaging product contact to the current timestamp.

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of WhatsApp messaging product contacts, including WhatsApp-specific fields and joining with the contact entity.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

200.description: List of WhatsApp messaging product contacts

post.description: Creates and stores a WhatsApp contact linked to a messaging product, using WhatsApp-specific product details.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of statuses based on optional filters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns a paginated list of statuses matching a partial text (using regex ~) in sender_data, receiver_data, or product_data.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Text to match in content fields
parameters.name: likeText

get.description: Returns a paginated list of statuses where a given key matches a partial value using regex (~).
get.summary: Search statuses by key and content

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Text to match on the key
parameters.name: likeText

get.description: Returns the number of status records that match the provided query parameters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns a paginated list of statuses filtered by WhatsApp message ID (wamID) and other query parameters.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns a paginated list of users based on optional filters. Restricted to admin users only.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

put.description: Updates user data by ID including email and role. Restricted to admin users only. Cannot update su@sudo.

post.description: Creates a new user account with the provided information. Restricted to admin users only.

delete.description: Deletes a user by ID. Restricted to admin users only. The special user su@sudo cannot be deleted.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of users where the specified key matches a partial value using ILIKE operator. Restricted to admin users only.
get.summary: Search users by key and text (Admin only)

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated user.

put.description: Updates the profile details of the authenticated user. Users can update their name and password, but NOT their email address.

parameters.description: User data to update (email field is ignored)
parameters.name: body

delete.description: Deletes the authenticated user from the database.

post.description: Issues access and refresh tokens based on the provided grant type (password or refresh_token).

get.description: Returns a paginated list of registered webhooks.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

put.description: Updates a webhook identified by its ID with new URL, authorization, event, and method settings.

post.description: Creates a new webhook with the specified URL, authorization header, method, timeout, and event type.

delete.description: Deletes a webhook using the provided unique ID.

get.description: Used by Meta to verify the validity of the webhook endpoint.

parameters.description: Phone number ID provided by Meta
parameters.name: waba_id

parameters.description: Challenge token returned by the endpoint
parameters.name: hub.challenge

parameters.description: Verification token defined in Meta dashboard
parameters.name: hub.verify_token

post.description: Processes the context handler and all change handlers. If an error occurs, it is returned.

parameters.description: Phone number ID provided by Meta
parameters.name: waba_id

parameters.description: Content sent by WhatsApp Cloud API
parameters.name: input

get.description: Filters webhooks using the ILIKE operator on a specified field and partial value.
get.summary: Query webhooks by key and partial value

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Returns a paginated list of webhook execution logs.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Upgrades the connection to WebSocket to start sending a campaign and receive real-time status and results. Use message types: "send", "cancel", "status", and "ping".

parameters.description: Optional: customize message sending behavior (currently not used)
parameters.name: function

400.description: Invalid campaign ID or bad request

get.description: Establishes a WebSocket connection and streams incoming and outgoing WhatsApp messages in real-time for a specific workspace.
Upgrades the HTTP connection to a WebSocket stream to receive real-time message status updates for a specific workspace.
Validates workspace membership for WebSocket connections using header or query param
All websocket routes with the "websocket" prefix are authenticated with this user middleware. messageChannel is the channel that the user wants to subscribe to.
Retrieves a paginated list of WhatsApp templates using the Graph API.

500.description: Unable to retrieve templates from API

get.description: Returns a list of all workspaces the authenticated user is a member of.

post.description: Creates a new workspace and adds the creator as admin member.

get.description: Returns a specific workspace by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a workspace. Requires workspace.admin policy.

patch.description: Updates an existing workspace. Requires workspace.settings policy.

get.description: Returns a list of pending invitations for the workspace.

post.description: Creates an invitation for a user to join the workspace.

get.description: Returns a list of all members in the workspace with their policies.

post.description: Adds a new member to the workspace with specified policies. Requires workspace.members policy.

delete.description: Removes a member from the workspace. Requires workspace.members policy.

patch.description: Updates the policies for a workspace member. Requires workspace.members policy.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of phone configurations for the workspace.

parameters.description: The offset from where to start the items
parameters.name: offset

post.description: Creates a new phone configuration for the workspace.

get.description: Returns a specific phone configuration by ID.

delete.description: Deletes a phone configuration from the workspace.

code.description: Error codes (not HTPP codes) described at https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes/

fbtrace_id.description: Unique identifier for the error. Use this ID when contacting support.

message.description: A combination of the error code and title.

details.description: Describes the error and provides most probable reason. Might contain information about how to solve the error. Example: Message failed to send because there were too many messages sent from this phone number in a short period of time.

code.description: Language and locale code. E. g. pt_BR.

x-enum-comments.Authentication: Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as AUTHENTICATION to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.
x-enum-comments.Marketing: Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as MARKETING to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.
x-enum-comments.ReferralConversation: Indicates a free entry point conversation.
x-enum-comments.Service: Indicates that the conversation opened by a business replying to a customer within a customer service window.
x-enum-comments.Utility: Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as UTILITY to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.

action.description: An action object with what you want the user to perform after reading the message. See action object for full information.

body.description: Optional for type product. Required for other message types.

footer.description: An object with the footer of the message.

header.description: Header content displayed on top of a message. You cannot set a header if your interactive object is of product type.

type.description: The type of interactive message you want to send.

catalog_id.description: ID for the catalog the ordered item belongs to.

text.description: Text message from the user sent along with the order.

message_id.description: ID of the message to react to. Something like "wamid.HBgLM..."

type.description: The type of interactive message received.

messaging_product.description: Null if manager received the message.

sender_data.description: Specific data that allows to send message.
Specific data that allows to send message.

content.description: Additional information about the error provided by the service that generated it. E. g. if an ORM returns an error, it will be propagated here as the raw error.

message.description: Short text describing the error as best as we can for humans.

from.description: Null if manager sent the message.

from_id.description: Null if manager sent the message.

messaging_product.description: Null if manager received the message.

product_data.description: Specific data about the product. For example, the webhook data received.

receiver_data.description: Specific data about the product. For example, the webhook data received.

sender_data.description: Specific data that allows to send message.

to.description: Null if manager received the message.

to_id.description: Null if manager received the message.

from.description: The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as input when sending a message to the customer.

id.description: The ID for the message that was received by the business. You could use messages endpoint to mark this specific message as read.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the WhatsApp server received the message from the customer.

sender_data.description: Specific data that allows to send message.

to_id.description: Messaging product contact id to send message.

biz_opaque_callback_data.description: Arbitrary string used for tracking messages, groups of messages, you name it...

recipient_identity_key_hash.description: To use it you need to allow identity check at code.service. If the field is provided, this message will only be sent if "recipient_identity_key_hash" matches client's current hash.

name.description: Add type:enum('WhatsApp'); when it becomes supported by GORM and PostgreSQL

last_read_at.description: Timestamp of the last read action.

phone_number.description: Available at from field on received messages.

wa_id.description: Available at from field on received messages.

phone_number.description: Available at from field on received messages.

wa_id.description: Available at from field on received messages.

waba_id.description: Phone Number ID from Meta (unique when active)

product_data.description: Specific data about the product. For example, the webhook data received.

biz_opaque_callback_data.description: Arbitrary string used for tracking messages, groups of messages, you name it...

errors.description: An array of error objects describing the error. Error objects have the following properties, which map to their equivalent properties in API error response payloads.

id.description: The ID for the message that the business that is subscribed to the webhooks sent to a customer

recipient_id.description: The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as input when sending a message to the customer.

product_data.description: Specific data about the product. For example, the webhook data received.

timeout.description: The timeout in seconds. 0 means no timeout

event.description: Event type associated with the webhook, required

url.description: Webhook URL, required and must be a valid URL

event.description: Optional updated event associated with the webhook

url.description: Optional updated URL, validated to be a valid URL

button.description: Required for list messages. It cannot be an empty string and must be unique within the message. Emojis are supported, markdown is not. Maximum length: 20 characters.

catalog_id.description: Required for Single-Product Messages and Multi-Product Messages. Unique identifier of the Facebook catalog linked to your WhatsApp Business Account. This ID can be retrieved via Commerce Manager.

flow_action.description: Optional for Flows Messages. navigate or data_exchange. Use navigate to predefine the first screen as part of the message. Use data_exchange for advanced use-cases where the first screen is provided by your endpoint.

flow_action_payload.description: Optional for Flows Messages. Required only if flow_action is navigate.

flow_cta.description: Required for Flows Messages. Text on the CTA button, eg. "Signup". Maximum length: 20 characters (no emoji).

flow_id.description: Required for Flows Messages. Unique identifier of the Flow provided by WhatsApp.

flow_mode.description: Optional for Flows Messages. The current mode of the Flow, either draft or published.

flow_token.description: Required for Flows Messages. A token that is generated by the business to serve as an identifier.

product_retailer_id.description: Required for Single-Product Messages and Multi-Product Messages. Unique identifier of the product in a catalog. Maximum 100 characters for both Single-Product and Multi-Product messages. To get this ID, go to Commerce Manager, select your Facebook Business account, and you will see a list of shops connected to your account. Click the shop you want to use. On the left-side panel, click Catalog > Items, and find the item you want to mention. The ID for that item is displayed under the item's name.

sections.description: Required for List Messages and Multi-Product Messages. There is a minimum of 1 and maximum of 10.

reply.description: The reply object contains the title and ID of the reply button.

type.description: The only supported option is reply for Reply Button Messages.

id.description: A unique identifier for the button reply.

title.description: The title of the button reply.

data.description: Optional. The input data for the first screen of the Flow. Must be a non-empty object.

screen.description: Required. The id of the first screen of the Flow.

description.description: The description of the list reply.

id.description: A unique identifier for the list reply.

title.description: The title of the list reply.

product_retailer_id.description: Required for Multi-Product Messages. Unique identifier of the product in a catalog. To get this ID, go to Commerce Manager, select your account and the shop you want to use. Then, click Catalog > Items, and find the item you want to mention. The ID for that item is displayed under the item's name.

product_items.description: Required for Multi-Product Messages. There is a minimum of 1 product per section and a maximum of 30 products across all sections.

rows.description: Required for List Messages. Contains a list of row objects. Limited to 10 rows across all sections.

title.description: Required if the message has more than one section. Maximum length: 24 characters.

caption.description: Optional and not used for audio or sticker media.

filename.description: Optional and used for document media.

id.description: To use id your media should be in the meta server. You can upload an media to the meta server with https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media.

link.description: To use link your media should be in a publicly available server.

message_id.description: ID of the message you want to answer.

biz_opaque_callback_data.description: Arbitrary string used for tracking messages, groups of messages, you name it...

recipient_identity_key_hash.description: To use it you need to allow identity check at code.service. If the field is provided, this message will only be sent if "recipient_identity_key_hash" matches client's current hash.

from.description: The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as input when sending a message to the customer.

id.description: The ID for the message that was received by the business. You could use messages endpoint to mark this specific message as read.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the WhatsApp server received the message from the customer.

forwarded.description: Set to true if the message received by the business has been forwarded.

frequently_forwarded.description: Set to true if the message received by the business has been forwarded more than 5 times.

from.description: The WhatsApp ID for the customer who replied to an inbound message.

id.description: The message ID for the sent message for an inbound reply.

referred_product.description: Referred product object describing the product the user is requesting information about. You must parse this value if you support Product Enquiry Messages.

body.description: Body for the ad or post.

ctwa_clid.description: Click ID generated by Meta for ads that click to WhatsApp.

headline.description: Headline used in the ad or post.

image_url.description: URL of the image, when media_type is an image.

media_type.description: Media present in the ad or post; image or video.

source_id.description: Meta ID for an ad or a post.

source_type.description: The type of the ads source; ad or post.

source_url.description: The Meta URL that leads to the ad or post clicked by the customer. Opening this url takes you to the ad viewed by your customer.

thumbnail_url.description: URL for the thumbnail, when media_type is a video.

video_url.description: URL of the video, when media_type is a video.

catalog_id.description: Unique identifier of the Meta catalog linked to the WhatsApp Business Account.

product_retailer_id.description: Unique identifier of the product in a catalog.

body.description: Describes the change to the customer's identity or phone number.

customer.description: The WhatsApp ID for the customer prior to the update.

identity.description: Hash for the identity fetched from server.

new_wa_id.description: New WhatsApp ID for the customer when their phone number is updated. Available on webhook versions v11.0 and earlier.

wa_id.description: New WhatsApp ID for the customer when their phone number is updated. Available on webhook versions v12.0 and later.

customer_changed_number.description: A customer changed their phone number.

customer_identity_changed.description: A customer changed their profile information.

index.description: Only for button type. This is actually an integer string.

id.description: Represents the ID of the conversation the given status notification belongs to.

type.description: Indicates conversation category. This can also be referred to as a conversation entry point

biz_opaque_callback_data.description: Arbitrary string used for tracking messages, groups of messages, you name it...

errors.description: An array of error objects describing the error. Error objects have the following properties, which map to their equivalent properties in API error response payloads.

id.description: The ID for the message that the business that is subscribed to the webhooks sent to a customer

recipient_id.description: The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as input when sending a message to the customer.

object.description: The specific webhook a business is subscribed to. The webhook is whatsapp_business_account.

WorkspaceAuth.description: Workspace ID (UUID) for multi-tenant access. Required for all workspace-scoped endpoints.
WorkspaceAuth.name: X-Workspace-ID
